page.title: 14RIVER TYNE EXCURSION
page.content: {BY ROBERT TAYLOR AGED 9 YEARS ON FRIDAY 12 JULY WE WENT ON THE RIVER TYNE. WE GOT ON THE BOAT AND SAT DOWN AND WE WENT TOWARDS THE BRIDGES AT NEWCASTLE. WE SAW A LOT OF CRANES AT THE DOCKS WHERE ALL THE SHIPS ARE BUILT AND MENDED. WE ALSO SAW SOME DRY DOCKS AND A LOT OF SMALL BOATS ANCHORED TO THEIR SIDES AND SOME LARGE SHIPS. THERE WAS A BIG WHITE FERRY SHIP WHICH WAS TAKING PEOPLE, CARS AND TRUCKS OVER TO DENMARK AND THEN TO SWEDEN, AND WE SAW A RUSSIAN SHIP. WE HAD OUR DINNER ON THE BOAT. WHEN WE HAD FINISHED OUR DINNER WE SAW THE BRIDGES AT NEWCASTLE BUT WE COULDN'T GO THROUGH, SO WE TURNED AROUND AND WENT BACK. ON THE WAY BACK WE SAW A SHIP BEING LOADED WITH COAL AND WE SAW THREE TUGS. THE LAST BIG SHIP THAT WE SAW WAS A NAVY SHIP. THEN WE WENT TO THE MOUTH OF THE RIVER.
